question:
The internet has transformed the way information is shared and consumed, but it also created problems that did not exist before.


What are the most serious problems associate with the internet and solutions can you suggest?
text: There is a big revolutionary change which comes due to the burgeoning use of computers and the internet in data transfer and consumption. But, at the same time, their use results in several obstacles which are completely undiscovered. The main problem associated with this is the increasing rate of cybercrime and the most effective solution is that government should make laws relating to cyber security.

One evident issue is that tremendous change in sharing information results in growing cyberterrorism cases. This is because people are well conversant to work with technology but they are not acquainted with its ill effects. These threats are expanding at an alarming rate such as viruses, drones, malware, ransomware and  any other form. The risk of all these attacks is increasing day by day which is beyond the control of anyone. For example, the Association of Threat control published that e-crime rates  doubled during the global pandemic.

The most effective solution to the above problem is that officials should provide some legalization to eliminate these e-attacks. By doing this, hackers  fear  punishment and imprisonment which leads to a decline in the crime rate. At the same time, the legal policy helps in the identification of every unauthorized message and transaction. Moreover, various laws not only enable individuals to identify the source of origin but also provide with complaint filing procedure. For example, with the enactment of the Information Technology Act, of 2001, there are certain norms and guidelines for the protection of the local public from cyberterrorism.
In conclusion, the interest and technological advancement create pavement for umpteen criminal offences but bureaucracy should remove all barriers by passing various laws and acts.
